page.title: 11THE GRAVEL WORKS.
page.content: Half a mile or so North-East of Little Houghton there is an{aggregate {works.}The aggregate is used in four different ways:_ (a) concrete, (b) mortar, (c) ashfelt, (d) drainage. They have been digging at Little Houghton for almost{50 years.}The material extracted is a 60:40 mix of sand and gravel which is found 2 metres below the surface to a further depth of{2 metres.}On average 40 tonnes of material can be removed each hour. The sand and gravel is sold in pre-packed bags that start at 5 kg. The works are noisy and there is a {hard hat area.}Lorries periodically appear clanking along a lane that shows the strain of heavy use. A {weighbridge}on site checks lorries on and off adjacent to a group of pre-fabricated office buildings.
